snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said the $49.8 million acquisition would preserve a significant portion of the upper Hudson River watershed and boost tourism.
abstract: New York State is acquiring 69,000 acres of land in the Adirondacks for $49.8 million; purchase will boost state tourism and preserve a significant portion of the upper Hudson River watershed.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said the $49.8 million acquisition would preserve a significant portion of the upper Hudson River watershed and boost tourism.

headline.seo: New York State to Buy 69,000 Acres in the Adirondacks
headline.main: State to Buy 69,000 Acres in Adirondacks
headline.print_headline: State to Buy 69,000 Acres in Adirondacks
